column2: Our story   At Alight, we believe a companys success starts with its people. At our core, we Champion People, help our colleagues Grow with Purpose and true to our name we encourage colleagues to ??e Alight.??  Our Values:     Champion People   ??be empathetic and help create a place where everyone belongs.   Grow with purpose ??  Be inspired by our higher calling of improving lives.   Be Alight ??  act with integrity, be real and empower others. It?? why we??e so driven to connect passion with purpose. Our team?? expertise in human insights and cloud technology gives companies and employees around the world the ability to power confident decisions, for life. With a comprehensive total rewards package, continuing education and training, and tremendous potential with a growing global organization, Alight is the perfect place to put your passion to work. Join our team if you Champion People, want to Grow with Purpose through acting with integrity and if you embody the meaning of Be Alight. Learn more at careers.alight.com. Alight Pay  is a product roadmap innovation to create our own IP payroll engine. Where we have still to build the country solution, the role holder starts by focusing on delivering all the key information to define the country local standard build within Alight Pay, working closely with the Products team. Once the country is deployed and the localization has been completed, the role switches to maintenance and support mode across a BAU environment and client implementation work. The  Payroll Country owner (PCO)-JAPAN  is responsible to define the local payroll country set up of Alight Pay and the ongoing maintenance and health of the country solution. They provide payroll expertise and outputs to deliver compliant country payroll calculations, legal compliance into the core pay engine and maintain the country standard ongoing. They also lead client country activation and act as the payroll manager supporting the client and internal teams on the account once live. The core summary of the PCO role is; Country Standards ??identify best payroll practices in country, define and maintain the country standards, and support the teams to uphold the standards. Maintenance and Compliance ??continual review and update of country standard solution to identify and adapt to legal changes and incorporate into all design documents, workbooks, and other material to maintain country compliance. Country Testing ??validating all created standards and rules through testing of created country solution within Alight Pay. Project Management ??is accountable for the Alight Pay country payroll activation for customers. Works as part of a wider project team during activation and implementations. Payroll Management ??assist client and internal teams on country payroll and coordinate payroll activities. Ongoing Payroll activity ??once a client is live ensure that the payroll is run to the correct standard, SLA?? are met and work with the Delivery Expert on any issues, escalations or client CRs. Payroll Country Owner Key Responsibilities Owns the payroll solution for the country  Key point of contact for sales on the specifics of the country solution Monitor regulatory environment and ensure changes are understood, planned and incorporated into the country payroll standards and workbooks Maintain documentation for country standard payroll processing Maintain all the country standard workbooks and documentation that state what is included in the standard deployment for the country in line with country legislative changes Work with the project management team in activation of new customers to the tool. Accountable for the Alight Payroll client activation for their country. Review account status and participate in service review meetings with the client. Support country payroll teams in running payroll and providing tier 1 support and triage for all technical questions and problems Manage and maintain clear and informative communications to internal teams and the client to support the efficient processing of payrolls and systems.  Work with relevant teams across Alight to ensure changes to the technical environment is understood, tested and that all documentation is updated to reflect those changes  Upskill and develop team members through training delivery and coaching to enable them to fulfil their role Knowledge, Education, Certification, Skills & Technical Proficiencies BA/BS (related in Finance or Accounting) or equivalent combination of education & experience Fluent in English (written, oral) Fluent in Nihongo (Japanese) Advanced level of Excel country legislation expertise HR Consulting, payroll and outsourcing industry experience A solutions-based thinker with a natural inquisitive mind  Attention to detail Work Experience At least 7 years??experience in a payroll role Business analysis experience  Experience working for a global organization with a multi-cultural environment Flexible Working   So that you can be your best at work and home, we consider flexible working arrangements wherever possible. Alight has been a leader in the flexible workspace and ??op 100 Company for Remote Jobs??5 years in a row. Benefits We offer programs and plans for a healthy mind, body, wallet and life because it?? important our benefits care for the whole person. Options include a variety of health coverage options, wellbeing and support programs, statutory retirement , vacation and sick leave, maternity, paternity & adoption leave, continuing education and training as well as a number of voluntary benefit options. By applying for a position with Alight, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Alight?? employment policies. Background checks may include some or all the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position. Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion Alight is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We celebrate differences and believe in fostering an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and supported. We know that diverse teams are stronger, more innovative, and more successful. At Alight, we welcome and embrace all individuals, regardless of their background, and are dedicated to creating a culture that enables every employee to thrive. Join us in building a brighter, more inclusive future. Diversity Policy Statement Alight is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against anyone based on sex, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital or domestic partner status, citizenship, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristics or conduct covered by federal, state or local law. In addition, we take affirmative action to employ and advance in the employment of qualified minorities, women, disabled persons, disabled veterans and other covered veterans. Alight provides reasonable accommodations to the known limitations of otherwise qualified employees and applicants for employment with disabilities and sincerely held religious beliefs, practices and observances, unless doing so would result in undue hardship. Applicants for employment may request a reasonable accommodation/modification by contacting his/her recruiter. Authorization to work in the Employing Country Applicants for employment in the country in which they are applying (Employing Country) must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the Employing Country and with Alight. Note, this job description does not restrict management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities of this job to other entities; including but not limited to subsidiaries, partners, or purchasers of Alight business units. We offer you a competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization. Pay Transparency Statement: Alight considers a variety of factors in determining whether to extend an offer of employment and in setting the appropriate compensation level, including, but not limited to, a candidate?? experience, education, certification/credentials, market data, internal equity, and geography. Alight makes these decisions on an individualized, non-discriminatory basis. Bonus and/or incentive eligibility are determined by role and level. Alight also offers a comprehensive benefits package; for specific details on our benefits package, please visit: https://bit.ly/Alight_Benefits DISCLAIMER: Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities of this job to other entities; including but not limited to subsidiaries, partners, or purchasers of Alight business units.

column2: The Payroll Analyst is a key role having responsibility to validate of payroll outputs for assigned EMEA countries. The primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to, controlling of payroll process, validation of payroll results, support internal stakeholders and answering on employee s queries.   This role will be an integral part of the payroll services team under the direction of the Payroll Supervisor. The Payroll Analyst will act as the contact for interface design and support, systems configuration, testing efforts and system support.          This role will serve as the Payroll SME during configuration and implementation project, focusing on systems efficiencies and documentation in addition to supporting payroll processing and backup to Payroll Administrator. This role will be responsible for troubleshooting and supporting internal stakeholders and supplier partners in accordance with defined business processes as approved by the Payroll Manager. The scope of this role will cover ADP product offerings for EMEA countries, including ADP time management, ADP payroll management, ADP GL and systems integration with all inbound/outbound data partners.             HOW YOU WOULD CONTRIBUTE:         Accurately and timely payroll validation of monthly payroll data in line with key controls and payroll compliance in all steps of the payroll cycle.     Prepare standard and ad hoc reports using report writing tools, supporting reporting requirements of the payroll department, stakeholders and internal/external audit.     Support internal stakeholders and timely answering on employee s queries via MySupport tickets.     Manage change control efforts for configuration changes and interface enhancements/new development.     Understand all internal policies and procedures. Ensuring adherence to all payroll processes defined by the Payroll Leads.      Support a culture of continuous improvement and collaboration with the payroll team consistent with Herbalife s mission, vision, and values.     Interacts with all levels throughout organisation; distributors, customers, and vendors.             SKILLS AND BACKGROUND REQUIRED TO BE SUCCESSFUL:         Skills   :       Fluent English language and one other European language is a plus.     Possess strong analytical and listening skills, with attention to details.      Professional and positive and possess a high degree of self-motivation and have the ability to work independently in your job.     Ability to create, implement and manage processes to achieve set outcomes.     Excellent communication, interpersonal, relationship and consensus building skills and effectively gains agreement and consensus for ideas within the department and other key stakeholders as needed.     Able to efficiently manage competing priorities, multi tasking with limited supervision in a fast-paced environment.     Able to identify and mitigating operational risk through effective controls.     Payroll processing, tax filing, general ledger, and HR system integration.             Experience:         1-3 years experience in payroll processing for EMEA countries. Functional/technical payroll operations and systems role in an ADP environment, preferably with ADP Celergo.     Knowledge of payroll regulations and reporting requirements, including federal and multi-state payroll taxes.     Experience with system integrations between payroll and vendors and internal Herbalife Systems   (ADP Celergo, ADP eTime etc.).     Experience in payroll process design, metrics, project management and change management.     Microsoft Office; Excel, Word and PowerPoint required, Project and Access a plus.     Managing interface design and automation which requires a level of technical expertise in addition to the functional expertise required.             Education:         Bachelor s degree in Business, HR Management, Finance, or related discipline.

column2: Joining the existing Professional Services Team within IRIS Human Capital Management as part of the Customer Adoptions Programme. The programme encompasses a wide scope of highly successful software products that you will be integral to facilitating customers moving from desktop solutions to cloud. The Programme is planning to influence 18,000 customer journeys and migrations over the next two years and is critical for IRIS to achieve one of our key strategic imperatives. Your role will be integral to ensuring a seamless journey for every customer to the new software.  Main Responsibility:   To support the transition of Iris desktop payroll products to cloud based solutions To prepare customer data for the transition To maintain a high standard of Payroll knowledge  To provide internal training as and when required To assist the Support Team as and when required  Experience and sound knowledge of Payroll and HR Legislation An understanding of Automatic Enrolment legislation Knowledge of IRIS Payroll software (advantageous) Working day : Mon - Friday Shift timing : UK shift

Process and communicate garnishment information to all parties.     Work alongside a third-party service provider to ensure that the company follows federal, state, and local legal requirements, establishing state tax, unemployment tax and local city/territory accounts as necessary.     Responsible for monitoring and completing tax filings on a timely basis, as necessary.     Coordinate with the appropriate legal team member as it relates to the establishment of new state legal entity registrations where the Company may have recently hired individuals to ensure the appropriate setup for payroll tax remittances.     Research payroll tax payments and any data discrepancies with federal, state, and local agencies, and work with tax agencies as well as internal parties for resolution on a timely basis.     Assist with leading process enhancements to develop a best-in-class payroll process. Assist to facilitate the W-9 vendor process.     Assistance with the 1099 process.         Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned. column2: This role involves collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, collecting and reviewing payroll data, ensuring compliance with tax regulations, and adhering to the organizational accounting code of conduct. Key Responsibilities: Payroll Processing: Execute end-to-end payroll processing for employees, ensuring accuracy in calculations and adherence to company policies and regulations. Verify time and attendance records, bonuses, commissions, and other related payments. Compliance: Stay up-to-date with local, state, and federal payroll regulations and ensure compliance. Process payroll taxes accurately and submit required reports to relevant authorities. Record Maintenance: Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee payroll records, including changes in salaries, benefits, and tax withholdings. Prepare and maintain relevant payroll documentation and reports. Benefits Administration: Coordinate with HR to ensure accurate administration of employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other deductions. Payroll Queries: Address employee inquiries regarding payroll matters promptly and professionally. Collaborate with HR to resolve issues related to payroll discrepancies. Reporting: Generate and analyze payroll reports to ensure accuracy and completeness. Prepare periodic reports for management, finance, and other relevant departments. Systems Management: Utilize and maintain the payroll system, ensuring it is updated with accurate employee information. Collaborate with IT for system upgrades and issue resolution.
column11: Payroll, TDS, Compliance, Benefits Administration, Payroll Executive, Payroll Specialist, Payroll Processing, Record Maintenance

column2: Graduate with 4+ years of experience in payroll, accounting & compliances department.     Ability of multi-tasking under pressure whilst maintain calm, professional & customer focused attitude.     High level of integrity, accountability & responsibility.     Deal with huge numbers & maintain confidentiality.     Strong people-oriented and good interpersonal skills     Sharp problem solver & analytical mind bend.     Strong written and verbal communication skills     High energy, with a positive work attitude     Pro-active approach towards work and learning.     Flexible approach to working hours.     Professional customer service attitude.      Focused & detail oriented.                               Role & Responsibilities:                 PAYROLL         :         Should have enough understanding & logical thinking behind every concept of payroll terms, its application in payroll system & implication on different destination.     Expatriate taxation, working with gross ups & dealing with monthly & yearly international reporting.     End to End Payroll processing until finalization of payroll independently.     Execute multiple micro processes post finalization of salary until the delivery of payroll.     Should have well versed with reporting of different reports to different stakeholders in the company.     Should be pro-active and able to think multiple solution scenarios of a problem simultaneously.     Should be confident enough to face the customers, the problems and get solutions in a quick way.     Should aware end to end Form-16 PartA & B reconciliation before issuing to employees.     Should maintain TDS tracker on perquisites paid by the employer.     Should have good knowledge of excel to prepare end to end bonus calculation for all consulting & local business function employees.      Professional customer service attitude.     Capability of dealing with banks & external various vendors.             COMPLIANCES:             Should have Knowledge & good understanding on statutory & Labour compliances.      Should be well versed with preparing data for filing up of TDS returns, PF returns, Professional tax returns, Labour welfare funds & its implication upon filing to respective domains.     Dealing with different compliance vendors to get all the compliances in place every month.     Arrangement of various helpdesk in office premises.                       ACCOUNTING /AUDITS:             Should know monthly payroll journal entries booking & other works related to accounting leading to month end close. This will be an added advantage.     Should have capabilities to clear all payroll related reconciliations       Should work with internal auditors, statutory auditors & tax auditors to help in audits.

column2: Skill required:  Payroll - Payroll Planning and Distribution Designation:  Payroll Operations Associate Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 1 to 3 years  What would you do? Improve workforce performance and productivity, boosts business agility, increases revenue and reduces costsPayroll experience Germany and ANZ SAP and Ticket ToolThe Payroll Planning and Distribution team focuses on distributing employees' pay on time through chosen channels such as banks and execute the distribution of earnings statements either manually or electronically. The team is also responsible for resolving payroll problems within the confines of established policies & procedures using relevant payroll system. What are we looking for? column1: Senior Associate / Subject Matter Expert - Payroll & Timesheet
column2: We are hiring for Payroll and Timesheet role! Shift: US Location: Noida Working Model: 5 Days from Office Function and Role Overview:  Hays Business Services (HBS) is the shared services for Hays Plc. This role sits in the Finance Shared Services (FSS) division of HBS, providing centralized function and process support for the Hays Plc business. To act as an expert in the team & able to lead the team in absence of team leader, mentoring the existing team members and conducting trainings of new team members. To ensure the team by taking on all escalations and resolving issues before they require input from the team leader. To enable the team to work to their maximum capacity by continually training those associates that need specific attention. Monitoring the transactions processed by the team and giving feedback to the teams in or absence of team leader. Role & responsibilities:   Operational management: Act as a point of 1st line escalation. If an associate has a query, work with them to resolve it. If still irresolvable, own the query through the issue log process  Maximizing motivation of the team to achieve excellence Key in temporary worker timesheets submitted by paper Key in and process holiday timesheets Key in temporary expenses Check data on timesheets Process timesheets query from payroll teams. Two way communication with Hays offices due to nature of queries (inbound and outbound query tracking)  Provide administrative support to Temp Payroll teams Ensure awareness and understanding of key performance indicators (KPIs)/service level agreements (SLA) performance and the performance of the Temp Payroll teams against them  Escalate issues where required Assist in the production of exception reports and spreadsheets Ensure Flex Temporary Payroll team work effectively with Payroll Control & Support team to ensure mutual understanding of current volumes and controls Ensuring work allocation is done & timelines are met in absence of team leader Support and provide guidance to associates Transaction monitoring of the transactions processed by the assigned team members     Desired Candidate Profile: Technical competencies Proactive in managing exceptions of timesheets management and building strong relationships with team members/team leader Self-motivated team player who is well organized, has attention to detail and an ability to prioritize complex workloads Technical expertise in timesheet management and process training Quick decision making Specific job experience Finance graduate and relevant experience of timesheet entry and exceptions management gained over 3-4 years Proven experience in managing exceptions of timesheets management and building strong relationships with team members / team leader Experienced in managing transactional processes of timesheet management Situational requirements Able to work across multiple time zones; shift work will be required  Fluency in written and oral English; Spanish / Portuguese desirable Experience with Navision and / or Great Plains desirable

column2: Maintain payroll information by collecting, calculating, and entering data. His/her duties will involve but not restricted to intricate calculations of department specialization payments, car allowances, wage garnishments, retro and overtime.             Update payroll records by entering changes in exemptions, insurance coverage, savings deductions, and job title and department/division transfers etc,         Handle workflow to guarantee all payroll operations are precisely and promptly worked on.         Prepare reports by compiling summaries of earnings, taxes, deductions, leave, disability, and non-taxable wages.         Prepare the YTD documents required for the reconciliation and audit purpose.         Maintain the MIS of payroll.         Monitor tickets and mails and respond within the SLAs.         Support the documentation of audit requirements for SOX compliance, other internal control activities as required.         Provide backup support for team members during time off and as needed to maintain workload management and meet service level deadlines.         Contribute to special projects, ad-hoc projects and assignments as directed by management.         Have respect for and maintain privacy parameters of operations, professional protocols, and personal confidentiality.             Who you'll Work With:       In this role you will be responsible for payroll processing & payroll accounting. Need to work closely with internal teams who supports payroll. This role will report to the EMEA Payroll Manager.           Minimum Requirements:             bachelors / masters degree in accounting & finance.         Europe Payroll processing experience in a large multinational company environment.         Hands on experience - ERP systems like SAP, Peoplesoft, Fusion, ADP developed software -workforce, HCM, Payforce, etc,         A working knowledge of applicable government regulations with leading edge understanding and familiarity with MS Office package, especially the use of Excel.         Experience with business process and leading practices relating to payroll.         Strong project management, detailed-oriented, organizational and time management skills.             What you'll Bring:             Hands on experience - ERP systems like SAP, Peoplesoft, Fusion, ADP developed software -workforce, HCM, Payforce, etc,         Ability to collaborate and partner with other departments and vendors to provide an error free payroll.         Ability to take the lead in researching and resolving issues, as needed.         Ability to take ownership of special projects and effectively deliver positive results.         Operational accounting and expertise in excel

column2: Hi, We are hiring for Leading ITES Company for US Payroll Specialist Profile. Roles&Responsibilities: The Payroll Representative prepares, documents and disburses payroll checks,payroll taxes and employee benefit payments. The Payroll Representative work assignments are often straightforward and of moderate complexity.  Upload garnishment documents to our vendor daily  Run daily reports for garnishment refunds, add refunds to associates next check  Run daily report for direct deposit rejects, create payment to associate  Run Employee Data reports as needed for providing details to other areas  Complete Workday and HomeCare HomeBase (HCHB) inbox tasks that are assigned to Payroll  Work calls/inquiries from associates and leaders regarding pay related questions such as corrected timesheets, holiday pay guidelines, and direct deposit changes  Support the branches with questions regarding the various timekeeping systems,  Run timesheet reports to find associates who have not entered/submitted time  Run timesheet reports to find managers who have not approved timesheets  Create batch uploads for Non- Cash Compensation payments to be taxed, such as gift cards  Enter Military Differential payments per request from HR Leaves  Run PTO Payout report and make entries for associates who have exceeded the annual PTO accrual according to the guidelines by the Service Contract Act  Enter and update our Voluntary deduction changes for Fitness Center, Parking, Political Action Committee, Charity, and Union dues  Print and mail pay slips to termed associates upon request  Assist in Workday EIB loads  Provide payroll solutions to HR4U Tier 2 calls  Would be responsible for providing US payroll compliance training to team members  Would be performing Team Quality checks  Would be assisting the team in various queries  Preparing and updating process maps, SOP , SIPOC  -Will be responsible for IQMS and internal Audit deliverables for TCS  -Should have understanding of various Quality documents like FMEA, RCA, Control Chart  - Ensure data privacy processes is followed with upmost focus  - Maintains and improves quality results by adhering to standards and guidelines; recommending improved procedures  - ensures efficiency of service center operations, technology and transaction processes.  -Establishes standards and procedures for handling employee questions, transactions and administration of human resource programs  -Coordinates services with the human resource information systems, human resource program managers and technology specialists  -Decisions are typically focus on methods, tactics and processes for completing administrative tasks/projects  - Regularly exercises discretion and judgment in prioritizing requests and interpreting and adapting procedures, processes and techniques  works under limited guidance due to previous experience/breadth and depth of knowledge of administrative processes and organizational knowledge.

column2: Job Description Responsibilities: 1.  Poland Payroll Management:  - Process and manage end-to-end payroll for employees based in various states across the Poland . - Calculate wages, overtime, commissions, and other payroll-related components accurately. - Ensure timely and accurate processing of payroll, adhering to designated pay schedules. - Address and resolve payroll-related inquiries from employees promptly. 2.  Child Support and Garnishment Management:  - Handle child support and garnishment orders, ensuring compliance with relevant regulations. - Accurately calculate and deduct garnishments from employees' paychecks. - Collaborate with HR and legal teams to handle special payroll cases, such as child support modifications. 3.  Timesheet Review and Reconciliation:  - Review and verify employee timesheets in QuickBooks Online (QBO) against work schedules. - Address discrepancies and make necessary adjustments to timesheets. - Assist employees with timesheet submissions and provide training, if required. 4.  Timesheet Review Against Invoices : - Cross-reference employee timesheets against customer invoices to ensure accuracy. - Collaborate with project managers and sales teams to resolve any discrepancies. - Track billable hours and non-billable hours for accurate invoicing and payroll processing. 5.  Payment Reconciliation : - Reconcile payroll payments with the payroll register to ensure accuracy. - Address any discrepancies and rectify errors promptly. - Work closely with finance and accounting teams for seamless payment processing. 6.  Compliance and Regulatory:  - Stay up-to-date with Poland payroll laws, regulations, and tax guidelines. - Ensure strict compliance with federal, state, and local payroll regulations. - Assist in preparing payroll tax reports and filings as required by regulatory authorities. 7.  Process-Oriented Approach:  - Demonstrate a meticulous and process-oriented approach to payroll management. - Follow established procedures to ensure consistent and error-free payroll processing. - Implement process improvements to enhance payroll efficiency and accuracy. 8.  Quality-Oriented Resource:  - Maintain a keen eye for detail and accuracy in all payroll-related activities. - Conduct regular audits to identify and rectify any anomalies. - Perform payroll data audits to ensure data integrity and accuracy. 9 . Timely Execution of Work:  - Handle payroll-related tasks and inquiries promptly and efficiently. - Ensure that payroll activities are completed within designated timelines. - Process off-cycle payrolls as needed, ensuring timely payment to employees. 10.  Act as an Expert HR Resource : - Collaborate with HR teams to address payroll-related HR matters. - Assist in onboarding new employees, ensuring accurate payroll setup. - Provide support during employee offboarding, including final settlements. Requirements: - Proven experience as a Payroll Administrator, preferably with expertise in managing Poland payroll. - Familiarity with payroll laws, regulations, and tax guidelines in the Poland. - Experience with child support and garnishment management is essential. - Proficiency in QuickBooks Online (QBO) for timesheet review and adjustments. - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with excellent attention to detail. - Highly organized with the ability to handle multiple tasks and meet strict deadlines. - Exceptional process orientation and compliance-driven approach. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. - Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a global team. - Prior experience working with Poland clients or companies will be an advantage. Polish speaking would be ideal.

column2: Triveni Almirah  is looking for HR Professional  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.An HR Professional is responsible for executing various human resources (HR) functions within an organization. Key responsibilities include: 1.	Recruiting and staffing: sourcing, screening, and hiring new employees. 2.	Employee relations: addressing and resolving employee concerns, complaints, and conflicts. 3.	Performance management: conducting performance evaluations and providing feedback to employees. 4.	Employee development: creating and implementing employee training programs and career development plans. 5.	Compensation and benefits: administering employee compensation and benefits programs, such as salaries, bonuses, and insurance. 6.	Compliance: ensuring compliance with federal and state employment laws and regulations. 7.	Policy development and administration: creating, updating, and communicating HR policies and procedures. 8.	Employee records management: maintaining accurate and up-to-date employee files and records. 9.	Diversity and inclusion: promoting and fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace culture. 10.	Other HR-related tasks as assigned by management. Qualifications: 1.	Strong knowledge of federal and state employment laws and regulations. 2.	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with employees at all levels of the organization. 3.	Good organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively. 4.	Experience with HR information systems (HRIS) and other HR technology solutions. 5.	Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive employee information. 6.	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve HR-related issues.
